description: Currently using Ubuntu 19. I couldn't get mkchromecast to detect devices. This picked up a Sonos play 1 after first launch.

It found my system immediately and seems to be working without any major problems. The only issue and reason for four stars is that it is not recognizing Spotify as a service. It does have my favorites and is playing off Spotify, it just does not call it out in the services menu.

The app is working great for me. In some respects it's outperforming the native SONOS app on a similarly spec'd laptop, so there's that. Everything seems to be working well. One reviewer mentioned not being able to pull up Spotify, but I had no issues - just had to re-authorize the controller via the web and all good (noson explains the reason for this is that Spotify credentials can't be pulled from the Sonos system. Makes sense.)
summary: Works great. Relieved I don't have to mess with wine

description:
Similar as Norris - connects fine and reflects the music playing. Volume, skip, pause etc work fine. Great to have that on the computer without having to reach for the phone.

That said, you can not search Spotify to change music. I can access my favorites but that's it. I have to use my phone to search Spotify and select the music. Once it is selected and playing, I can use the noson app to control it. Better than nothing, but it doesn't replace the need for your phone close by.
Worked right after install on my Ubuntu 18.04 machine. Seems to have all the functionality I'm used to having with the official version.

Can do the basic stuff, but the services are not there anymore,
App has difficulties to catch up after use of the phone to change the current music.
Really enjoying this Sonos controller. I've got access to my most often used functions, and I think the app looks better than the native Sonos controller. Well done!
It worked great, than one day just stopped working, might be some issues with security updates ... anyway its not finding the Sonos devices anymore
Does not find my Sonos.
as summary says program just didnt work
great, but currently doesn't work with Ubuntu on Wayland, Xorg fine however
limited to the music folder on the system. un able to tell noson where to index, this week can no longer search tunein for stations, find the sonos speakers and can adjust sound not to much else

First, the thing looks like a mobile app on my laptop. It's vertically viewed when I open it. If it has a desktop view, it should have auto-detected it. Can't add Google Music. It was already registered on the official app. When I click register nothing happens. Also, its a snap app. Why can't it just be a standard deb package? What is with all this snap stuff?
summary: Layout stinks. Can't add Google Music

description: Just having a few graphical issues when I'm resizing the window, but I'm able to choose different speakers and playlists - so great job!
It simply doesn't work on my computer!

The app located my speakers fine, allowed me to select music to play, and played it. That's great! However, the UI is quirky and certain services don't work as well as they should. For example, I can't drill down into station categories in the SiriusXM service (it seems to treat the category itself as a station and displays an error when I try to access it). Also there are no "album covers" displayed for Pandora stations. Minor issues, but annoying.
GUI is a little flakey

I only use Spotify so I cannot vouch for the other services.
For Spotify use it adds certain features I do not have in the Spotify app on Linux.
summary: Does what it says and does it well

description: I thought this was non functional - but all you have to do is re-add your sources and it works perfectly
summary: Great - note you need to re-add your sources!

description: In a previous review I couldnt figure out how to sync volume across multiple devices. In the Sonos app just lower the main slider to zero and all speakers volume are in sync. This app you need to lower each volume slider down to zero individually for all to be in sync. No big deal. 5 stars

This worked immediately and is way faster than Sonos official on Mac. The artwork is displayed superfast. Anyone used to Sonos lag-g-g-g-g-ing the loading of artwork will appreciate this. Great work. Also super fast access to EQ settings but where's the balance knob? That's my missing star, I want to access L/R-alance also.
summary: Great app, one thing missing for 5/5

description: I have been using Sonos with my Apple devices. Not really happy with the results. So, I thought I would give this a try. It was up and running faster than Sonos! Any luck it will do a better job at controlling the devices than the legacy OS Sonos aps! Je vous remercie, Jean-Luc!
Aple to stream straight to my Sonos.

bietet alles, was man für die Steuerung benötige
Bei TuneIn vermisse ich allerdings u.a. "Meine Radiosender", "Meine Radiosendungen", "Lokalradio"

Sonos Lautsprechen wurden gleich gefunden. Anmeldung an Sonos Radio geht leider nicht. TuneIn kann man leider auch nicht mit Anmeldung nutzen, zumindest habe ich es nicht gefunden. Anmeldung zu Apple Music aber problemlos.
reputation Album Of The Year 2017
La intale, la probe y la borre

como se  usa  eE  DESIME
8 AÑOS
No detecta nada
no es mala pero aún le falta trabajo pues es sumamente consumidora de recursos.

installation : SONOS Amp: + SONOS Play : 1 / noson 3.11.9
j'ai tapé SONOS dans l'application logiciels Ubuntu sans vraiment y croire mais ce programme est parfaitement compatible avec mon installation, contrôle par zone simple ou multiple, service radio et la synchronisation avec les commande sur mes autres appareil est fonctionnelle.
merci beaucoup pour ce travail !
summary: parfaitement compatible avec les produits SONOS

description:
Installation sans soucis. 
Tout l'univers Sonos a portée de clic !
Je recommande
extra
Installation facile, sans bricolage de barbu avec Wine ou autres. Fonctionne parfaitement, tous services, toutes pièces. Super boulot !
Aucune zone trouvé n'est pas fonctionnel
Impressionné, marche parfaitement. Bravo !
не ищет никаких радио. ноль.
